programme.desc: The Gorilla Dissolution: Penny re-evaluates her life, including taking a big step with Leonard, while Howard and Bernadette struggle to look after Mrs Wolowitz.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Status Quo Combustion: With potential changes affecting different aspects of his personal and professional life, Sheldon is forced to confront an uncertain future.

programme.title: Live Football: Morocco v Comoros
programme.desc: The Africa Cup of Nations begins. The Atlas Lions are strong. Hosts. Bookies' favourites. Recent World Cup semi-finalists. But the Coelacanths are hardly fossils. Can they cause an upset?

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The Gig and the Girlfriend: To impress a girl in the year below, Simon attends his first concert since he saw Take That with his mum. But Will, Jay and Neil tag along too.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will's Dilemma: Simon and his new girlfriend Tara double date with Will and Tara's friend Kerry, but Will wonders if it's worth spending time with a girl he finds boring.

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: (2018) Comedy. Mark Wahlberg and Rose Byrne star as a couple whose orderly lives are disrupted when they foster three kids. Based on director Sean Anders' own experience.

programme.desc: (1972) Historical drama with Keith Michell as Henry VIII, nobly supported by Donald Pleasance, Charlotte Rampling and Jane Asher. The dying monarch reviews his own life.

programme.title: The Desert Fox
programme.desc: (1951) Drama. James Mason stars in Henry Hathaway's sympathetic portrait of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel in the final years of his life during the Second World War. With Jessica Tandy.

programme.title: The Lavender Hill Mob
programme.desc: (1951) Classic Ealing comedy starring Alec Guinness as a mild-mannered bank clerk who assembles a gang to hijack a million quid's worth of gold. Which is when their problems really start...

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: (2013) Sci-fi action-mystery set on a war-ravaged planet Earth that's been largely abandoned by humanity. With Tom Cruise, Andrea Riseborough, Olga Kurylenko and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: (2022) Drama starring Emma Thompson as a recently widowed, retired teacher who has a sexual bucket list she wants to get around to now that she has the time and, perhaps, even the energy.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: (1983) Francis Ford Coppola's seminal brat pack coming-of-age crime drama with Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Matt Dillon and Rob Lowe. Two teenage tribes go to war in Tulsa.

programme.title: Hue & Cry
programme.desc: (1947) The very first Ealing comedy is set in the post-war East End. A boy tries to catch a gang of thieves who are using his favourite comic to communicate their dastardly deeds.

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: (1961) Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel. Two men fleeing the US Civil War find an island inhabited by monsters (animated by Ray Harryhausen) and the mysterious Captain Nemo.

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: (2011) Family comedy. Jim Carrey stars as a work-obsessed New York property developer whose life is turned upside down when he receives a crate containing six live penguins.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Nightmare Alley
programme.desc: (2021) Guillermo del Toro's star-studded carny thriller with Bradley Cooper and Cate Blanchett. Can a chancer with a dark past use clairvoyancy to fleece rich New Yorkers out of a fortune?

programme.desc: (2023) Darkly comic Gothic horror about the travails of a foppish emissary of the King of France in a gloomy forest inhabited by a very odd family. With Kacey Mottet Klein. In French/subs.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Riley Falcon: Dave's in Lincolnshire picking up a 1935 Riley Falcon - a good-looking saloon car, with a pre-select gearbox.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Rollo Croftmaster Tractor: Derek brings a small army of military hardware to Thornton le Dale including a Studebaker Weasel tracked vehicle and a WWII-era Willys Jeep.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Bodie USA: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off the Florida coastline.

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Cowley to Hunton Bridge: Robbie mends a leaky pump on the Naughty Lass on the Grand Union Canal. In Watford, he visits a TV legend's home and buys gas from a friendly fuel boat.

programme.desc: Shopping from Home.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway
programme.desc: War Weekend takes place on the North York Moors Railway, celebrating the part played by the railways during World War II, with around 30,000 visitors expected to attend.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway
programme.desc: The three-day autumn Steam Gala takes place on the North York Moors Railway, and the organisers try to bag an amazing locomotive as this year's 'celebrity guest'.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: 1924 Rover 9HP Tourer: Paul collects a cherished 1924 Rover 9 that's been in the same family since the 1950s and only had one previous owner before that.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: 1954 Morgan Plus 4 Coupe: Derek heads north to pick up a 1954 Morgan Plus 4 coupe in mint condition and believed to be just one of three still on the road.

programme.title: The Great War In Numbers
programme.desc: Total War: Learn more about the 'war to end all wars' through illuminating and often shocking statistics. After 1916, the imperial powers redoubled their efforts to win the war.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler's War
programme.desc: This Has Happened: Hitler's War moves to its endgame as the Soviets cross the German border - with a death toll of over 40 million, a new, scarred Europe will emerge.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Stowe House 1: Fiona Bruce and the team travel to Stowe House in Buckinghamshire, where items include a 16th-century print and evidence of one of the earliest Beatles concerts.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Cawdor Castle 1: Items under scrutiny at Cawdor Castle near Inverness include the best bargain-buy dolls ever seen on the show.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash: Restoring Classics
